oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantum mechanics emerging from stochastic dynamics of virtual particles
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsekov, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
Physics - Classical Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It is demonstrated how quantum mechanics emerges from the stochastic dynamics of force-carriers. It is shown that the quantum Moyal equation corresponds to some dynamic correlations between the momentum of a real particle and the position of a virtual particle, which are not present in classical mechanics. The new concept throws light on the physical meaning of quantum theory, showing that the Planck constant square is a second-second cross-cumulant.
Comment: Presented at EmQM15, Vienna, Austria
